definition[0]: used to say that something will be the same whichever of two things happens or is true
example[0]: You can get to Edinburgh by train or plane, but either way it’s very expensive.
definition[1]: more or less than a certain amount or measurement
example[1]: A few marks either way can make the difference between a pass and a fail.
definition[2]: used to say that someone or something does not firmly support or want either one of two things
example[2]: ‘All right, let’s do that, ’ said Camille, who didn’t care either way.
